metadata.title: OpenJDK: integer truncation issue in Xalan-J (JAXP, 8285407) (important)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: The Apache Xalan Java XSLT library is vulnerable to an integer truncation issue when processing malicious XSLT stylesheets. This can be used to corrupt Java class files generated by the internal XSLTC compiler and execute arbitrary Java bytecode. Users are recommended to update to version 2.7.3 or later. Note: Java runtimes (such as OpenJDK) include repackaged copies of Xalan.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
xalan is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
